notes.text: Built on the site of the Chitimacha village Kas Kec Namu.

notes.eng: There are no restrictions on access to this location.

description: A location, optionally with accompanying geographic coordinate data
$comment: This is a top-level database object
title: Location

___link.description: A URL where a presentational format for this resource may be viewed
___link.title: Link

___dateModified.description: The date and optionally time that this Location was last modified
___dateModified.title: Date Modified

___type.description: The type of object. Must be set to `Location`.
___type.title: Type

$eref.description: A tag is a piece of metadata that can be applied to almost any DLx object. The tags object contains a set of tags for this resource as pairs of attributes and values. For example, a researcher might tag a suffix with the attribute `person`, and a value of `3`, to indicate that the particular suffix is 3rd Person. If no value is needed, the value may also be set to `true` or `false` (but not `null`), however users are encouraged to use both attribute and value for every tag, since this helps identify the larger category that the tag value belongs to. Note: The Tags object does not have a `type` property.

additionalProperties.description: A single tag, as an attribute-value pair.
additionalProperties.title: Tag

$eref.title: Tags

___tags.description: A set of tags for this Location
___tags.title: Tags

___geoJSON.description: A GeoJSON object describing this Location. Must adhere to the GeoJSON format: https://geojson.org/.
___geoJSON.title: GeoJSON Geometry Object

notes.eng: Speaker also requested that this text only be shared with family members.
The tribe has requested that language materials only be made available to academic researchers who have been given permission, and enrolled tribal members.

$eref.description: The Access Rights object provides information for archives on who should be allowed to access the current resource. Some access protocols used by language archives are already supported, and custom protocols may be used as, e.g. `online: false` or `permission: researcher only`, etc. **Note:** The Access object does not have a `type` property.
$eref.title: Access Rights

___ELAR.description: For users who are depositing their materials at the Endangered Language Archive (ELAR) in London, an `ELAR` attribute may be added, and its value set to one of the access levels set forth by the archive. See [ELAR's protocols for access management](https://www.soas.ac.uk/elar/using-elar/access-protocol/) for more information.
___ELAR.title: ELAR Access Level

___AILLA.description: For users who are depositing their materials at The Archive of the Indigenous Languages of Latin America (AAILA) in Texas, an `AILLA` attribute may be added, and its value set to one of the access levels set forth by the archive.
___AILLA.title: AILLA Access Level

___notes.description: Notes about access rights for this resource, or any other special considerations regarding who should have Access. This attribute should be a MultiLangString rather than an Array of Note objects.
___notes.title: Access Notes

___access.description: Since locations sometimes contain personal information like addresses, it is important to consider the proper access management policy for them.
___access.title: Access Rights

___^[(a-z)|(A-Z)|(0-9)]+$.description: The string of text in the specified language
___^[(a-z)|(A-Z)|(0-9)]+$.title: Text

$eref.description: A piece of text in multiple languages. This is typically used for analyses, database properties, and information in metalanguages rather than transcriptions or translations of data (for those, see the [Transcription](https://spec.digitallinguistics.github.io/schemas/Transcription.html) and [Translation](https://spec.digitallinguistics.github.io/schemas/Translation.html) schemas). For example, the part of speech for a lexeme might be given as both English *noun* and Spanish *nombre*. Each key must be the abbreviation for a language (see the [Abbreviation](https://spec.digitallinguistics.github.io/schemas/Abbreviation.html) schema), and the value for that key is the string of text in that language. **Note:** MultiLangStrings do not have a `type` property.\n\nIf the text is in only one language and that language is English, it may be represented as a simple string instead of an object. Thus instead of `gloss: { eng: "M.SG" }` you can simply write `gloss: "M.SG"`.
$eref.title: Multi-Language Text / String

___name.description: A name for this location, e.g. `Susan’s House` or `Valley High School`, or `Shenandoah River`, optionally in multiple languages. The name must be provided in at least one language.
___name.title: Name

$eref.description: A human-readable abbreviation, containing on letters `a-z`, `A-Z`, and numbers `0-9` (no spaces allowed).
$eref.title: Abbreviation

___references.description: A collection of bibliographic references about this Location
___references.title: Bibliographic References

examples.title: Catgory genesis in Chitimacha
examples.publication: Category change from a constructional perspective

examples.title: On linguistics, linguists, and our times: A linguist’s personal narrative reviewed

$eref.$comment: This is a top-level database object
$eref.title: Bibliographic Reference

___lastName.description: The last name(s) of this author
___lastName.title: Last Name

___firstName.description: The first name(s) of this author
___firstName.title: First Name

___year.description: The year this item was published. Use a positive integer for AD / ACE, and a negative integer for BC / BCE.
___year.title: Year

___type.description: The type of object. Must be set to `BibliographicReference`.
___type.title: Type

___authors.description: An array of authors for this Reference
___authors.title: Authors

items.description: A Person object representing an author
items.title: Author

___editors.description: An array of editors for this Reference
___editors.title: Editors

items.description: A Person object representing an editor
items.title: Editor

___publisher.description: The name of the publisher of this reference, or the institution where it was published
___publisher.title: Publisher (or Institution)

___series.description: The series in which this publication was published
___series.title: Series

___edition.description: The edition of this Reference, formatted as an integer
___edition.title: Edition

___volume.description: The volume number for this publication
___volume.title: Volume

___pages.description: The page numbers of this Reference
___pages.title: Pages

___publication.description: The publication where this item was published
___publication.title: Publication

___translators.description: An array of translators for this Reference
___translators.title: Translators

items.description: A Person object representing a translator
items.title: Translator (Person)

___doi.description: The Digtial Object Identifier (DOI) for this publication. This should be just the DOI itself, not a URL, and should not include the `doi:` prefix (e.g. `10.1075/cal.20.02hie` not `https://doi.org/10.1075/cal.20.02hie` or `doi:10.1075/cal.20.02hie`).
___doi.title: Digital Object Identifier (DOI)

___id.description: A unique database identifier for this Reference
___id.title: ID

___city.description: The city in which this reference was published
___city.title: City

items.description: A bibliographic reference about this location
items.title: Reference

___url.description: The URL where information about this location can be retrieved
___url.title: URL

___streetAddress.description: The street address, not including apartment or unit number
___streetAddress.title: Street Address

___locality.description: The locality or city for this Address
___locality.title: Locality / City

___type.description: The type of object. Must be set to `Address`.
___type.title: Type

___country.description: The country this address is located in
___country.title: Country

___postalCode.description: The postal code for this address (as a string rather than a number)
___postalCode.title: Postal Code

___apartmentNumber.description: The apartment or unit number, along with any abbreviations, e.g. `Apt 20`
___apartmentNumber.title: Apartment / Unit Number

___region.description: The region or state for this Address
___region.title: Region / State

___address.description: An address associated with this location
___address.title: Address

___dateCreated.description: The date and optionally time that this Location object was created
___dateCreated.title: Date Created

___date.description: The date and optionally time that a language was spoken in this location
___date.title: Date

___notes.description: A collection of notes about this Location
___notes.title: Notes

examples.text: Msemaji huyu ni Janet Kerubo Momanyi.
Box turtles are known for eating strawberries.

$eref.description: A note about this resource. Notes may also include `type` and `language` attributes.
$eref.title: Note

___language.description: A language code or language name of the language that this note is written in
___language.title: Note Language

___dateModified.description: The date and optionally time that this note was last modified
___dateModified.title: Date Modified

___text.description: The text of the note itself
___text.title: Note Text

___type.description: The type of object. Must be set to `Note`.
___type.title: Type

___tags.description: A set of tags that apply to this Note. Useful for tagging notes that need review or responses, or marking a note as resolved.
___tags.title: Tags

___dateCreated.description: The date and optionally time that this note was created
___dateCreated.title: Date Created

___noteType.description: The type of Note. Required for notes on Lexemes.
___noteType.title: Note Type

___source.description: The name or initials of the person who is the source of the information in this Note. This is not necessarily the person who wrote it. For example, a linguist could make a note based on something that a speaker reports, in which case the speaker should be listed as the source.
___source.title: Source (Person)

___id.description: A unique database identifier for this Location
___id.title: ID
